00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 answerVariableList.pl - Creates answer checkers that compare the student's
00020 answer to a list of variable names.
00021 
00022 =head1 MACROS
00023 
00024 =head2 variable_cmp
00025 
00026  ANS(variable_cmp($var_string, %options))
00027 
00028 This answer checker compares the student answer to a list of
00029 variable names (so, for example, you can ask for what values a
00030 given function depends on).
00031 
00032 Use addVariables() to create the list of variables that from which
00033 the student can choose, and then use variable_cmp() to generate the
00034 answer checker.  If the formula passed to variable_cmp contains
00035 parentheses around the list, then the student's answer must as
00036 well.
00037 
00038 You can also include additional parameters to variable_cmp.  These
00039 can be any of the flags appropriate for List() answer checker.
00040 
00041 Usage examples:
00042 
00043     addVariables('x','y','z');
00044     ANS(variable_cmp("(x,y)"));
00045 
00046     addVariables('x','y','z','s','t,);
00047     ANS(variable_cmp("s,t"));
00048 
00049     addVariables('x','y','z');
00050     ANS(variable_cmp("(x)",showHints=>0,showLengthHints=>0));
00051 
00052 =cut
00053 
00054 loadMacros('MathObjects.pl');
00055 
00056 sub _answerVariableList_init {
00057   #
00058   #  A new context for variable lists
00059   #
00060   $main::context{VariableList} = Parser::Context->new(
00061     operators => {',' => $Parser::Context::Default::context{Full}->operators->get(',')},
00062     lists => {'List'  => {class =>'Parser::List::List'}},
00063     parens => {
00064      '(' => {close => ')', type => 'List', formList => 1},
00065      'start' => {close => 'start', type => 'List', formList => 1,
00066                  removable => 1, emptyOK => 1, hidden => 1},
00067      'list'  => {type => 'List', hidden => 1},
00068     },
00069     flags => {
00070       NumberCheck => 
00071         sub {shift->Error("Entries in your list must be variable names")},
00072       formatStudentAnswer => 'evaluated',  # or 'parsed' or 'reduced'
00073     },
00074   );
00075 
00076   main::Context("VariableList");  ### FIXME:  probably should require author to set this explicitly.
00077 }
00078 
00079 sub variable_cmp {
00080   Value->Package("Formula")->new(shift)->cmp(
00081     ordered => 1,
00082     entry_type =>'a variable',
00083     list_type => 'a list',
00084     implicitList => 0,
00085     @_
00086   );
00087 }
00088 
00089 =head2 addVariables
00090 
00091  addVariables(@vars)
00092 
00093 Adds each string in @vars as a varible to the current context.
00094 
00095 =cut
00096 
00097 sub addVariables {
00098   my $context = Context();
00099   foreach my $v (@_) {$context->variables->add($v=>'Real')}
00100 }
00101 
00102 1;
